body.p: Indiana attorney and governor. Brattleboro, Vermont, native. Married Mary B. Amsden Hammond. Father of Georgie Hammond Voorhies. Moved to Brookville, Indiana, as a child. Practiced law in Greenfield, Indiana, and Columbus, Indiana. Law Partner of John H. Bradley in Indianapolis, Indiana, in 1846. Practiced law in Cincinnati, Ohio, from 1847 to 1849. Judge of the Court of Common Pleas for Marion County, Indiana, in Indianapolis, Indiana, in 1850. Practiced law in San Francisco, California, from 1852 to 1855. Judge of the Court of Common Pleas for Marion County, Indiana, in Indianapolis, Indiana, in 1856. Elected Lieutenant Governor of Indiana as a Democrat in 1856. Governor of Indiana upon the death of Ashbel Willard from October 4, 1860 to January 14, 1861.
